factor_description: This is the initial probability of an ecoregion within the realm not being within a biome of “Deserts & Xeric Shrublands”.
role_in_simulation: The map used is based on current biomes. However, the simulation starts with some of the desert biomes possibly being any kind of grassland, “Temperate Broadleaf & Mixed Forests” or “Temperate Conifer Forests”. As the simulation progresses, these can switch to present-day desert.

factor_description: This is the initial population density per square mile in deserts within the realm.
role_in_simulation: These densities are later converted to actual numbers of people.

factor_description: This is the initial population density per square mile in tundra within the realm.
role_in_simulation: These densities are later converted to actual numbers of people.

factor_description: This is the ratio of the initial population density per square mile in a biome within the realm to the mean of initial_pop_density_of_desert and initial_pop_density_of_tundra.
role_in_simulation: This is used to set the initial_pop_density for each biome/realm combination (with the exception of combinations containing desert or tundra).

factor_description: This is the initial probability of an ecoregion within the biome/realm combo transitioning to being within a desert biome in year 1.
role_in_simulation: This factor only has an effect on biomes containing the word “grassland”, plus the biomes of “Temperate Broadleaf & Mixed Forests” and “Temperate Conifer Forests”.

factor_description: This is the maximum initial population density per square mile in the ecoregion, excluding ecoregions within desert or tundra.
role_in_simulation: It is unaided in the sense that this is what it would be for a hunter-gatherer society without advanced technology.
other_constraints: Must be at least 1.5 times max(initial_unaided_d_max_pop_density, initial_unaided_t_max_pop_density)

factor_description: This is the maximum initial population density per square mile in the ecoregion (only considering ecoregions within desert).
role_in_simulation: It is unaided in the sense that this is what it would be for a hunter-gatherer society without advanced technology.

factor_description: This is the maximum initial population density per square mile in the ecoregion (only considering ecoregions within tundra).
role_in_simulation: It is unaided in the sense that this is what it would be for a hunter-gatherer society without advanced technology.
The transportation_tech_level_in_use (like all of the other tech_level_in_use factors) will always be between 0 and 1. Higher values indicate more sophisticated technology.
This is used in a weighting scheme of the graph whose edge weights are distances between locations.
